chief.note: Did not proceed to Stockholm, but negotiated a treaty with Sweden which was signed at Paris on April 3, 1783.
An earlier nomination of May 29, 1813 had been rejected by the Senate. Served at the court of Sweden and Norway; resident at Stockholm.

Served at the court of Sweden and Norway; resident at Stockholm. No report has been found concerning Hughes’s presentation of credentials as Chargé d’Affaires en titre; he had been serving at Stockholm as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim since October 1818.

A
Did not proceed to post.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Did not proceed to post, his nomination having been rejected by the Senate while he was en route.
Not commissioned; nomination first confirmed and then reconsidered by the Senate, with no final action taken.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post in this capacity.
Nomination of June 16, 1992 was not acted upon by the Senate.
